meanings.definition: A process of voting, in writing and typically in secret.
meanings.sent1: During the election, each person filled out a ballot to choose their favorite candidate.
meanings.sent2: The ballot box was full of votes from the citizens.
meanings.sent3: The ballot made everyone feel like they were part of a special club.
meanings.sent4: Her decision was like a ballot, carefully selecting the best option.
meanings.sent5: The ballot paper fluttered to the ground, carrying the hopes of many.

meanings.definition: A piece of paper used for voting.
meanings.sent1: Please grab a ballot and mark your choice with an X.
meanings.sent2: The ballot had the names of all the candidates printed on it.
meanings.sent3: The colorful ballot looked like a work of art.
meanings.sent4: His heart raced as he folded the ballot, sealing his decision.
meanings.sent5: The ballot slipped out of her hand, swirling in the wind like a leaf.

meanings.sent1: They will ballot for the new class president tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: Let's all ballot on which movie to watch tonight.
meanings.sent3: She decided to ballot for the best dessert at the party.
meanings.sent4: The team will ballot to choose the captain for the season.
meanings.sent5: He will ballot for his favorite team in the championship game.
